info.game_comments:
2002 College Championship quarterfinal game 5.
From the Schottenstein Center at the Ohio State University in Columbus.

(1, 1).clue: It's the only state that isn't on the North American continent

(2, 1).clue: Porcini & portobellos are types of these

(3, 1).clue: In Microids' "Ben Hur" you race these vehicles

(4, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from Amsterdam)  That's the official residence of Amsterdam's burgermeister, the Dutch equivalent of this U.S. official

(5, 1).clue: In a 1951 speech he said, "What we are doing in Korea...is...trying to prevent a third world war"

(6, 1).clue: A cobbler is someone who fixes or makes these

(1, 2).clue: Not surprisingly, Mormons make up about 70% of this state's population

(2, 2).clue: These 2 snacks are mentioned by name in "Take Me Out to the Ball Game"

(3, 2).clue: Rolling Stone magazine's choice for Console Game of the Year 2002 is the third installment of this carjack game

(4, 2).clue: Before e-mail, offices used these, memos for short

(5, 2).clue: On January 8, 1918 he told Congress, "A general association of nations must be formed"

(6, 2).clue: It's the 10-letter name for the job heard here in action

(1, 3).clue: Of the 4 states called commonwealths, the 2 that are farthest south

(2, 3).clue: Just squeeze the sweet navel or Valencia varieties & you've got this drink

(3, 3).clue: In the game based on this TV series you take on the roles of detective & prosecutor

(4, 3).clue: In "She's a hyperactive child therapist", it's not clear whether the adjective is doing this to "child" or to "therapist"

(5, 3).clue: In 1868 he yelled, "Let them impeach and be damned!"

(6, 3).clue: It's the occupation of the vast majority of the 2.7 million members of the NEA

(1, 4).clue: The magnolia is both the state tree & state flower of this, the "Magnolia State"

(2, 4).clue: Native to the Pacific coast, the Olympia type of this is often eaten on the half shell

(3, 4).clue: "The Angel of Darkness" takes this Eidos heroine in a new, darker direction & ups her polygons from 500 to 5,000!

(4, 4).clue: Soft & rich, not harsh; when followed by "out", it means "to relax"

(5, 4).clue: In 2002 Pres. Bush told Ohio State grads that each of them should do 4000 hours of this during their lifetimes

(6, 4).clue: Ironically, it was the occupation of the father & both grandfathers of Friedrich "God is dead" Nietzsche

(1, 5).clue: Bordering on 4 of the 5 Great Lakes, it has the largest shoreline of any inland state

(2, 5).clue: Sassafras & sarsaparilla originally went into & helped name this soft drink

(3, 5).clue: In battles in the game based on this Oscar-winning film, you probably have to use the "Far East" button on your control

(4, 5).clue: Its meanings include an area of open land & to tie a ship to a dock

(5, 5).clue: Teddy Roosevelt:"Let Congress debate, and while the debate goes on" this building project "does also"

(6, 5).clue: A wainwright is someone who builds or fixes these transports

(1, 1).clue: It took him 10 years to come out with "Don Quixote Part II"

(2, 1).clue: Nepal's most prominent institution of higher learning is Tribhuvan University, found in this capital

(3, 1).clue: A traditional Scotsman wears a purse called a sporran at the front of this garment

(4, 1).clue: This pass lets you travel by train for one price through 17 European countries

(5, 1).clue: The last of the 13 colonies to be founded, its "Mother City", Savannah, was settled in 1733

(6, 1).clue: It's the subject in an experiment, whether or not he's this South American rodent

(1, 2).clue: "Barrabas came to us by sea" is how this female author began "The House of the Spirits"

(2, 2).clue: The first of the "Noble Truths" of this man born in Nepal is that existence is suffering

(3, 2).clue: Don't be afraid to wear this long, fluffy scarf; it's probably made of feathers, not reptiles

(4, 2).clue: To visit some countries, it's recommended you be vaccinated for the "A" variety of this liver disease

(5, 2).clue: In the 1690s pirate captain Kidd was a big macher in this NYC church named for Father, Son & Holy Spirit

(6, 2).clue: To pretend to be dead or unaware of something is to "play" this animal, seen here

(1, 3).clue: Pablo Neruda's website is on the server of the university of this country of his birth

(2, 3).clue: Nepal, Pakistan & India all use this as their basic monetary unit

(3, 3).clue: This fur of a weasel that turns white in winter has been seen on royal raiment for centuries

(4, 3).clue: The IYHF lists hundreds of these places of lodging that travelers to Europe use to save money

(5, 3).clue: Margaret Brent, America's first woman barrister, was executor of the will of this colony's governor Leonard Calvert

(6, 3).clue: They're the 2 mammals used to describe a declining or rising stock market

(1, 4).clue: This "Blood Wedding" poet & playwright was executed in Spain in 1936

(2, 4).clue: The world's only national flag that is not a rectangle, Nepal's flag depicts these 2 heavenly bodies

(3, 4).clue: Sometimes it's a narrow, close-fitting dress & sometimes it's a holder for a sword

(4, 4).clue: Keep track of how much your dollar is worth by checking this "rate" at which currency is converted

(5, 4).clue: In 1612 John Rolfe introduced a new type of Trinidad tobacco to this settlement

(6, 4).clue: Northerners who symphatized with the South during the Civil War were referred to as these poisonous snakes

(1, 5).clue: In 1990 he became the first Mexican poet to win the Nobel Prize for Literature, not the eighth for Peace

(2, 5).clue: The majority of Nepal's people practice this official state religion

(3, 5).clue: Attention, -Wan Kenobi: heko & kaku are types of this sash worn with a kimono

(4, 5).clue: If you bring along electrical devices, bear in mind that much of the U.S. uses 110 volts but Europe uses this many

(5, 5).clue: Although it was a separate colony, New Hampshire shared a governor with this colony from 1669 to 1741

(6, 5).clue: This term for a cheap, dirty hotel sounds like a pouch for a parasitic insect

(0, 0).clue: A 2001 biography of this man is subtitled "Pioneer of the Mind"
